text: Rupert (5 May 1352 â€” 18 May 1410) was the Elector Palatine (as Rupert III) from 1398 and King of the Romans (King of Germany) from 1400 until his death in 1410. He was the king after Charles IV's son, Wenceslaus got deposed after prince-electors of Maine, Cologne, and Trier met up, and the next day the same 4 electors voted for him. ==References== Category:14th-century births Category:15th-century deaths Category:Holy Roman Emperors
title: Rupert of Germany
